Sentencas: The combination of biomass gasification with solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is gaining increasing interest as an efficient and environmentally benign method of producing electricity and heat.
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes

Sentencas: However, tars in the gas stream arising from the gasification of biomass material can deposit carbon on the SOFC anode, having detrimental effects to the life cycle and operational characteristics of the fuel cell.
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes

Sentencas: This work examines the impact of biomass gasification syngas components combined with benzene as a model tar, on carbon formation on Ni/CGO (gadolinium-doped ceria) SOFC anodes.
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes

Sentencas: Thermodynamic calculations suggest that SOFCs operating at temperatures > 750 degrees C are not susceptible to carbon deposition from a typical biomass gasification syngas containing 15 g m(-3) benzene.
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes

Sentencas: However, intermediate temperature SOFCs operating at temperatures < 650 degrees C require threshold current densities well above what is technologically achievable to inhibit the effects of carbon deposition.
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes

Sentencas: SOFC anodes have been shown to withstand tar levels of 2-15 g m(-3) benzene at 765 degrees C for 3 h at a current density of 300 mA cm(-2), with negligible impact on the electrochemical performance of the anode.
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes

Sentencas: Furthermore, no carbon could be detected on the anode at this current density when benzene levels were <5 gm(-3).
Titulo: The interaction of biomass gasification syngas components with tar in a solid oxide fuel cell and operational conditions to mitigate carbon deposition on nickel-gadolinium doped ceria anodes
